thread.title: UMass vs. Toledo live stream, radio broadcast: Where to watch the Minutemen Saturday
thread.title_full: UMass vs. Toledo live stream, radio broadcast: Where to watch the Minutemen Saturday

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass vs. Toledo live stream, radio broadcast: Where to watch the Minutemen Saturday
text:
The University of Massachusetts football team gets back at it Saturday looking to end its two-game losing streak against No. 19 Toledo. 
Kickoff is set for 3 p.m. at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough. 
Be sure to check out all of MassLive.com's preview coverage for the game right here . 
If you won't be making it out to campus to catch the game in person, don't worry! We've got you covered as you look for somewhere to follow along with the action. Let's take a look your options: Live blog 
First off, I'd suggest giving me a follow on Twitter because I'll be sharing commentary throughout the game. Those updates will also be part of a live blog I'll be running right here on MassLive.com. Online video 
I hope you've settled into the groove of watching UMass on your computer, phone or smart TV, because ESPN3 will be the only viewing option for fans again this week. 
Again, you can download the free WatchESPN app for your tablet or mobile phones for easy, on-the-go viewing. For more traditional viewing experiences (i.e. up on your TV screen), WatchESPN is also available for Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, Roku, Chromecast and Xbox 360/One. 
The ESPN3 broadcast is free, but whether you choose watch in the browser or on mobile, you'll be required to sign in with your cable provider before gaining access, so make sure you have your log-in information handy. Radio 
As always, fans can listen to the game on the radio with Josh Maurer and Matt Goldstein. Here are the local stations: 105.5 FM WEEI (Springfield/Amherst) 95.9 FM WATD (South Shore) 1200 AM WXKS (Boston, Manchester, Providence) 
You can also listen online via WEEI's website or with the TuneIn Radio app for smartphones and tablets. 
If worst comes to worst, you can always just follow along with the live stats on GameTracker . 
Follow MassLive.com UMass beat writer @Daniel_Malone on Twitter or reach him via email .
